physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Severe confusion, complete disorientation, neck stiffness, severe weakness of the limbs, urinary retention, molluscum contagiosum in the face, oral thrush.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Initially presented with severe symptoms; improved remarkably after two weeks of antiretroviral therapy with resolved headaches, disappearance of neck stiffness and urinary trouble, normal CSF cell counts and biochemical results.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: CD4+ T lymphocyte count: 35 cells/mL; Plasma HIV RNA level: 159,000 copies/mL; CSF HIV RNA level: 13,000,000 copies/mL.
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: MRI showed increased T2-weighted signal diffusely scattered with confluent aspect; electroencephalographic examination revealed diffuse abnormal findings; lumbar puncture yielded clear CSF with 22 mononuclear cells/mL, protein level of 80 mg/dL, glucose level of 41 mg/dL.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: After two weeks of therapy, neurological symptoms improved, and CSF cell counts returned to normal along with the biochemical test results.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Plasma HIV RNA level: <40 copies/mL; CSF HIV RNA level: 73 copies/mL.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Significant overall clinical improvement over the follow-up period, with continued decrease in HIV RNA levels in both plasma and CSF.
